(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors d+

```suggestion
lemma natCast_eq_one {n : â„•} (nezero : n â‰  0) : (n : Î±) = 1 := by
```
Can you add the `ofNat` version of this too, which should be proved directly with this lemma?
Done, thanks!

```suggestion
theorem natCast_eq_top {n : â„•} (hn : n â‰  0) : (n : Ideal R) = âŠ¤ :=
```

```suggestion
/-- `3 : Ideal R` is *not* the ideal generated by 3 (which would be spelt `Ideal.span {3}`), it is simply `1 + 1 + 1 = âŠ¤`. -/
```
Can you prove `natCast_eq_one` in terms of this or the other way around?

I did that originally in the first commit but it required importing `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.Basic` (at least to do so the way that was obvious to me via `nsmul_eq_mul`) so I reverted it in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20244/commits/e1a13efcd88b7b88eaf7e22b3900e3984151ef3f because the bot complained that added a large import.
I see, fair enough

After merging master (#20169 to be precise), this should become:
```suggestion
lemma ofNat_eq_one {n : â„•} [n.AtLeastTwo] : (ofNat(n) : Î±) = 1 :=
```

```suggestion
theorem ofNat_eq_top {n : â„•} [n.AtLeastTwo] : (ofNat(n) : Ideal R) = âŠ¤ :=
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Ideal): 37 cast to an ideal is just the whole ring.
